intro: Lappularia infesta, commonly known as the hairy lappularia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while the flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in a cluster. Lappularia infesta is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
